definitions.definition: to allow something to happen or someone to do something by not doing anything to stop an action or by giving your permission:
examples: She wanted to go but her parents wouldn't let her.

definitions.definition: used to show that you accept what is going to happen, although you do not like it:
examples: Let it rain - it won't spoil our afternoon.

definitions.definition: used to say that you wish something to happen very much:
examples: Oh, please let him get the job!

definitions.definition: (in tennis or similar games) a situation in which the ball touches the net as it crosses it, so that you have to play the point again
